intro: Psychotria pseudomaschalodesme, commonly known as the purple psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are typically consumed by various bird species. Psychotria pseudomaschalodesme is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
